page.title: 09PATOIS ERDINGTON
page.content: Patois literally means dialect. It is the language of Jamaicans and a few other West Indians. Patois is like a first language to us. When amongst friends and family we tend to speal Patois rather than English. Patois reminds us of our roots. It originated in the days of slavery. Patois can be a comfort to some West Indians when rejected from this society because of colour or race prejudice. Racism is constantly around and a black person feels more secure with Patois. As West Indians we speak Patois to show that we are proud of our origins. We are aware of our identity and must never forget it. There are many other ways to show our identity, through dance, music, poetry and stories. Personally if I gave up speaking Patois I would feel like I had given up a major part of my life.
